description: Variation of conditions 14, 16, 27 and 28 of planning permission 2018/4172 dated 01/11/2024. The purpose of the variations is to amend the legal agreement and conditions to allow occupation of 85% of the residential units prior to the completion of the commercial space and to require completion of the commercial space within 4 months of the occupation of any residential unit.
decision_conditions: Internal Ambient Noise Levels - Good StandardAll residential premises shall be designed in accordance with BS8233:2014 'Sound insulation and noise reduction for buildings-Code of Practice' to attain the following internal noise levels:- Good resting conditions: Living rooms 30 dB (day: T =16 hours 07:00 – 23:00)- Good sleeping conditions: Bedrooms 30 dB (night: T = 8 hours 23:00 – 07:00)LAmax 45 dB (night 23:00 – 07:00)The soundproofing of the building shall meet the standards demonstrated in the details approved as part of application 2023/2770 dated 21-05-2024REASON: To ensure that the occupiers and users of the proposed development do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of excess noise from environmental and transportation sources

Surface waterThe development shall be in full accordance with the details agreed with Thames Water in respect of Surface Water and approved as part of application 2024/0210 dated 21-05-2024.REASON - The development may lead to sewage flooding and network reinforcement works are anticipated to be necessary to ensure that sufficient capacity is made available to accommodate additional flows anticipated from the new development. Any necessary reinforcement works will be necessary in order to avoid sewer flooding and/or potential pollution incidents.

Commercial to Residential Acoustic ProtectionDwelling houses, flats and rooms for residential purposes sharing a party element with commercial premises shall be designed and constructed to provide reasonable resistance to the transmission of sound. The minimum airborne sound insulation of the party element shall be DnT’w of 60 dB. The approved scheme is to be completed prior to the commencement of the use hereby permitted and shall be permanently maintained thereafter. A test shall be carried out prior to the discharge of this condition to show the standard of sound insulation required shall be met and the results submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.REASON: To ensure that the occupiers and users of the proposed development do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of noise nuisance and other excess noise from activities within the commercial premises

Pre-commencement condition: Dust ManagementWorks of construction shall be carried out in full accordance with the  Dust Management Plan approved as part of application 2021/2225 dated 08-10-2021REASON: To ensure that and occupiers of neighbouring premises do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of pollution and dust nuisance

Air Quality AssessmentWorks of construction shall be carried out in full accordance with the Air Quality measures approved as part of applications 2020/0287 dated 04-06-2020 and 2023/2934 dated 19-02-2024REASON: To ensure that and occupiers of neighbouring premises do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of pollution and dust nuisance

Emission RatesThe emission rates of the development shall be in full accordance with the details approved as part of applications 2022/0017 dated 30-11-2023REASON: To meet the sustainability objectives

PV ArrayThe photovoltaic array shall be completed in full accordance with the details approved as part of applications 2023/2327 dated 21-05-2024 and 2024/0523 dated 21-05-2024. It shall be maintained in full operation for the lifetime of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning AuthorityREASON: To meet the sustainability objectives.

Sustainability StatementAll details of the scheme shall be in full accordance with the details in respect of sustainability approved as part of application 2021/3622 dated 28-10-2022.REASON: To meet the sustainability objectives

Overheating assessmentIn respect of overheating mitigation the scheme shall be in full accordance with the details approved as part of application 2023/2359 dated 21-05-2024.REASON: to mitigate the risk of overheating with passive strategies avoiding reliance on active cooling systems.

BREEAM Post-constructionWithin 12 weeks of first occupation of the Class E(g) commercial floorspace hereby approved, a BREEAM post-construction assessment (or any assessment scheme that may replace it) confirming an ‘Excellent’ rating (or another scheme target of equivalent or better environmental performance) has been achieved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.REASON: To ensure sustainable development.

Air Permeability Test ReportA) Within 12 weeks of occupation of the residential units hereby approved, a full air permeability test report confirming the residential units have achieved an average air permeability of 4 m3/h/m2@50pa shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This is unless the development is carried out in accordance with the details approved under application 2024/0370 dated 21-05-2024.B) Within 12 weeks of occupation of the Class E(g) commercial floorspace hereby approved, a full air permeability test report confirming the commercial development has achieved an average air permeability of 5 m3/h/m2@50pa shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.REASON: To ensure suitable energy efficiency measures.

Bird and Bat Box ProvisionThe bird and bat box provision shall be in full accordance with the details approved as part ofapplication 2023/2327 dated  21-05-2024.REASON: To provide potential habitat for local wildlife.

Refuse StrategyThe refuse strategy shall be in full accordance with the details approved as part of application 2023/2327 dated  21-05-2024.REASON: To ensure the development is satisfactorily served in terms of refuse collection and safeguard against the build-up of pollution.

Decking ScreeningScreening to the communal decking on the eastern facing edges of the shared deck spaces on the first and second floor of the development shall be installed in full accordance with the details approved as part of application 2023/2327 dated  21-05-2024 and shall be permanently maintained thereafter.REASON: To safeguard against potential overlooking of Monohaus

Flood Mitigation Measures The development shall not be occupied until all the mitigation measures referred to in the Flood Risk Assessment by Spillways dated October 2018 have been completed and implemented.REASON: To safeguard against flooding and pollution

Building Regs M4At least 10% of all dwellings across all tenure types within the development hereby approved shall be completed in compliance with Building Regulations Optional Requirement Part M4 (3) 'wheelchair user dwellings' (or any subsequent replacement) prior to first occupation and shall be retained as such thereafter. The remaining dwellings should also be built and maintained to a minimum of M4 (2) standard.REASON: To ensure that the development is adequately accessible for future occupiers.

LandscapingThe landscaping of the development shall be carried out in full accordance with the details approved as part of application 2023/2329 dated 21-05-2024.  All landscaping in accordance with the scheme shall be carried out within a period of twelve months from the date on which the development of the site commences or shall be carried out in the first planting (and seeding) season following completion of the development, and shall be maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority for a period of ten years, such maintenance to include the replacement of any plants that die, or are severely damaged, seriously diseased, or removed.REASON: To ensure that the landscaping is satisfactory and enhances the character, appearance and ecology of the development and contribution to green infrastructure, and that adequate playspace is provided.

Secure Bicycle ParkingInternal lockable space shall be made available within the building for the secure parking of 196 bicycles, as shown on the plans hereby approved, before the first occupation of the development.REASON: To ensure that a reasonable provision is made within the site for the parking of bicycles in the interest of relieving congestion in surrounding streets and improving highway conditions in general.

Demolition and Construction Management PlanWorks of construction shall be carried out in full accordance with the Demolition and Construction Management Plan approved as part of application 2021/2216 dated 08-10-2021REASON: To avoid hazard and obstruction being caused to users of the public highway and in the interest of public safety and amenity.

Contaminated land (Verification)The development shall be carried out in full accordance with the contaminated land post-development verification report approved as part of application 2023/2824 dated 21-05-2024. Any additional, or unforeseen contamination encountered during the course of development shall be immediately notified to the Planning Authority and Contaminated Land Officer. All development shall cease in the affected area. Any additional or unforeseen contamination shall be dealt with as agreed with the Contaminated Land Officer. Where development has ceased in the affected area, it shall recommence upon written notification of the Planning Authority or Contaminated Land Officer.REASON: To protect human health, water resources, property and the wider environment from harm and pollution resulting from land contamination.

Delivery and Servicing PlanThe Delivery and Servicing of the development shall be carried out in full accordance with the details approved as part of application 2023/2327 dated 21-05-2024.REASON: To ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice the free flow of traffic or public safety along the neighbouring highway(s).

Materials to be approved (entire site)All materials to be used on the external surfaces of the building, boundary walls and ground surfaces shall be in full accordance with the details approved as part of application 2022/1824 dated 21-05-2024.REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.

All brickwork colour, texture, facebond and pointing shall be in full accordance with the details approved as part of application 2023/2323 dated 21-05-2024.Reason: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory.

Detailed drawings/full particulars The detailed design of the development, including but not limited to facades, windows, doors, ground floor/entrances, balconies, balustrades and deck access shall be in full accordance with the details approved as part of application 2022/1824 dated 21-05-2024.REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.

No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipework shall be fixed to the (street) elevations of the building other than as shown on the drawings hereby approved.REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.

Perforated roller shuttersNo roller shutters shall be installed, unless otherwise agreed with the Local Planning Authority in writing.REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.

Contaminated land (Site Investigation and Remedial Action)All pre-development remedial actions for contaminated land shall be carried out in full accordance with the details approved as part of application 2021/3580 dated 27-04-2022.REASON: To protect human health, water resources, property and the wider environment from harm and pollution resulting from land contamination.

Secured by Design(1) Prior to carrying out above grade works (except demolition) of each building or part of a building, details shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that such building or such part of a building can achieve full Secured by Design' Accreditation. This is unless the development is carried out in accordance with the details approved under application 2021/3689 dated 27-04-2022.The development shall only be carried out in accordance with the approved details.(2) The development shall achieve a Certificate of Compliance to the relevant Secure by Design Guide or alternatively achieve Crime Prevention Standards to the satisfaction of the Metropolitan Police and the Local Planning Authority. Details of these shall be provided in writing to the Local Planning Authority and therefore built in accordance with.REASON: To ensure community safety

Sustainable Drainage SystemThe Sustainable Drainage Systems shall be in full accordance with the details approved as part of application 2021/3686 dated 26-04-2022.REASON: To mitigate against potential surface run off and flood risk

No roof plant, including all external enclosures, machinery and other installations shall be placed upon or attached to the roof or other external surfaces of the building unless otherwise shown on the approved drawings or approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to installation. REASON: To ensure that any external plant or machinery is acceptable in terms of its appearance and potential impact on residential amenity.
The development will contain 57 residential units, as shown on the drawings hereby approved.REASON: In order to define the planning permission.

The housing mix in the development hereby approved shall be 21 x 1 bed units, 23 x 2 bed units, and  13 x 3 bed units, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.REASON: To ensure that the housing mix in the development is acceptable.

The floor area of the B1 Use Class commercial space hereby approved shall be at least 2,179 square metres.Reason: To ensure that the provision of employment space is acceptable within the proposed development.

The scheme to control noise and vibration, as detailed in the noise report provided by Sol Acoustics, Ref P1993-ADN01-JPR, dated 25 September 2023 submitted with this application shall be implemented, as a minimum, before the hereby permitted use commences.  Such a scheme as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and thereafter retained and maintained in accordance with such details, and should comply with the following requirement at all times: The Rating Noise Level emitted from the hereby permitted plant or machinery shall not exceed 10dB below the prevailing background noise level at any neighbouring dwelling at any time.  A post installation noise assessment shall be carried out and the report shall be sent to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The equipment shall be maintained thereafter to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority, and the use hereby permitted must cease during any period that this condition is not complied with. REASON:   To protect the amenity of noise sensitive premises from noise from mechanical plant

All building services plants located externally within the development shall be supported on adequate proprietary anti-vibration mounts as necessary to prevent the transmission of vibration and regenerated noise to within adjacent parts of the proposed building(s) and these shall be maintained thereafter.REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration.

<p>Specification for fit out of business floorspace and Marketing Strategy</p><p>Prior to first occupation of more than eighty-five percent (85%) of the residential units a specification for the fit out of the business (class B1) floorspace, which shall be to a higher standard of fit out than ‘shell and core’, as well as a strategy for marketing this space shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The business floorspace shall thereafter be fitted out in accordance with these approved standards prior to the first occupation of more than 85% of the residential units within the development. This is unless the development is carried out in accordance with the details approved under application 2023/2329 dated 21-05-2024.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the proposed business floorspace is completed to a satisfactory standard, in order to be attractive to future occupiers.</p>
